oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sixth Avenue merchants whoop it up, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo published in the Nashville Times (1940), about a pageant in downtown Nashville: “.... Sixth Avenue merchants took to tandem bicycles and carriages this week in their Gay Nineties Revue. A group is shown here promenading down the avenue.” The sign of “Eat A Bite Cafe,” located on Sixth Avenue, is pictured in the background. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eat A Bite Café (Nashville, Tenn.)
